title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Software Quality Assurance Analyst

content.rendered:
What is a Software Quality Assurance Analyst?

Software Quality Assurance Analysts are analysts who are concerned with using software quality assurance principles for the development of software products. Their main responsibilities are to test software quality and predict problems that may occur in the future.

Where does a Software Quality Assurance Analyst work?

  • Government
  • Private offices

How much does a Software Quality Assurance Analyst make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Software Quality Assurance Analyst is $63,325.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Software Quality Assurance Analysts?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Software engineering majors
  • Computer science majors
Search Software Quality Assurance Analyst job opportunities on Handshake.

Software Quality Assurance Analyst skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Software Quality Assurance Analysts succeed in their work:

  • Background in management
  • Attention to detail
  • Good IT skills

What are some common questions about Software Quality Assurance Analysts?

Q: How do I become a QA Analyst?

A: Most roles will look well upon a bachelor’s degree as a good foundation for your career. Computer programming or software engineering are great majors to choose from. Try and secure some internships and jobs while you’re in undergrad and then start looking into some certification programs to really up your resume.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Software Quality Assurance Analyst.
